content.description:
Cruise up to the base to the large flat area and find a couple high bolts that lead into the obvious crack system that splits the tower (big roof).

First pitch is the crux with a possible 30+ foot groundfall if the string of #1 Peckers (and tiny Pika beaks) blows.

Bust through the choss into better rock and find the bolted belay on a ledge.

Pitch 2 goes up and attacks the roof using the right thin crack. Cams in soft rock leads upward. Pull the roof to better rock and belay at the notch.
content.protection:
10 #1 Peckers

8 #2 Peckers

5 #3 Peckers

triple rack of cams from Aliens to #5.

(2) #5s

content.description:
Climb up the wide hands to fists crack to enter a big pod.

Rest and compose yourself for the 5.11 OW exit.

Two bolt anchor

(We opted to put in our own anchor since Jeremy made it sound like his line was not very rappel friendly.  At least without a stick clip or a fixed line.)
content.protection:
Single #.5-1 Camalot

Double #2 Camalot

Triple #3 and #4 Camalot

Single #5 Camalot
content.location:
This route climbs the analog crack of 'Tighten it Up'.

This route is accessed by hiking across the land bridge to the NNW  of the tower.  Once across the land bridge and at the base of the tower carefully scramble around the Eastern side of the tower.  There is some big exposure but it's only 4th class.  That being said a rope might make you feel better.  There is a big ledge on the NNE side of the tower and two cracks splitting the tower.  'Loosen Up' is on the left.

content.description: Climb C1 over the bottom roof with small-med cams - this will go free, but looks hard.  Free climb up into the chimney, then through a 5.9 squeeze to a semi-rest at a small roof.  Grunt through the ~5.10 squeeze (I pulled on cams) to the top.  Build an anchor at the top (#3 and 5 useful), then traverse left 40' to Loosen Up anchor to rap.
content.location: Follow description for Loosen Up across land bridge and 4th class traverse to base of the wall.  This route is about 30' to the right of Loosen up, and obvious.
